title: Campanile, St. Zeno, Verona
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick, cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
description: Vertical sheet that has been cut down.  Depicted is a tall, slender Romanesque bell tower.  The tower has alternating rows of red and white masonry in the center.  The top of the tower is completed by two smaller towers at the corner and a steeple that is terracotta brown, to imply tilework.
name: Album page
